channel.title: I need serious help! =(
channel.description: So for Christmas I got a laptop with Windows 7 Home Premium. The wireless internet sometimes randomly dc's and when I try and reconnect it says "Unable to connect to [network name]". Half the programs on my laptop that I've downloaded don't work because of my gay firewall. My firewall is screwed up big time! I've tried playing runescape and I get redirected to http://world17.runescape.com/error_game_js5connect.ws because my firewall or something is blocking off port 43594. I made an exception in my firewall (In the inbound connections section) for port 43594 but it still gets blocked. I've tried downloading Trend Micro and House Call to scan for viruses but they can't be installed because "I'm not connected to the internet". I've tried opening Firefox, Safari, Netscape, Google Chrome, and Flock, but all of those so that they can't display the webpage and that I'm not connected to the internet. One program said I was having troubles with my proxy settings but I don't have a proxy set up! So these are 2 things I'm having serious troubles with: My firewall. My internet connection. Please help! I'm posting for help here because I know there are LOTS of 1337 computer wiz's here that can help. How do you think I should fix my problems I've been having? Oh, by the way, I've tried shutting off my firewall but that did nothing.

item.title: I need serious help! =(
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

wireless works perfectly fine for me, and im running windows 7 ultimate x64

try completely disabling the firewall and if it still does not work, it is not your firewall blocking everything, it is something else

Read full topic

item.title: I need serious help! =(
item.dc:creator: @r0ckstar96 r0ckstar96
item.description:
@r0ckstar96 wrote:

[quote=“Newty, post:4, topic:324994”]Windows 7 has some serious issues with wireless internet connectivity (imo). Google something like
“Windows 7 IPV4 Issues” or “Windows 7 IPV6 Issues” and you will be able to solve your problem… Worked for me anyways.[/quote]
I couldn’t find anything useful, although I looked at my Wireless Connection properties, and neither IPv4 or IPv6 are Installed. Could this be a problem?

Read full topic

item.title: I need serious help! =(
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

Windows 7 has some serious issues with wireless internet connectivity (imo). Google something like
“Windows 7 IPV4 Issues” or “Windows 7 IPV6 Issues” and you will be able to solve your problem… Worked for me anyways.

Read full topic

item.title: I need serious help! =(
item.dc:creator: @r0ckstar96 r0ckstar96
item.description:
@r0ckstar96 wrote:

Lin:

If you shut off your firewall, then what makes you so sure it’s your firewall blocking stuff? Even so, add software exceptions to your firewall (I’ve never used a Windows Vista or 7 one, so don’t ask me how) like you would on XP, if it’s even possible. Instead of using the default Windows 7 network manager, download some other one, or if you bought a wireless network adapter, use the software that came with it if it came with any. If you ARE using the software it came with, then try Windows 7’s. That’s all I can think of at the top of my head.

I’m using the built-in network adapter and I’m currently also connected to the local area connection of my family computer. I’ll do some looking around in the devices area of my computer. Sometimes I use a Linksys adapter that I didn’t install. I used it a few years ago with my old vista computer and had installed it but I lost the CD and am able to plug in the adapter and connect wirelessly without a problem. I’ll get back to you if I can find any other problems/solutions
(One day later)
I can’t find any problems, but I’m not going to go get it checked out because I’m saving up for… Well I don’t know, but I don’t want to waste a bunch of money for nothing. Thanks for trying to help Lin.

Read full topic

item.title: I need serious help! =(
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

If you shut off your firewall, then what makes you so sure it’s your firewall blocking stuff? Even so, add software exceptions to your firewall (I’ve never used a Windows Vista or 7 one, so don’t ask me how) like you would on XP, if it’s even possible. Instead of using the default Windows 7 network manager, download some other one, or if you bought a wireless network adapter, use the software that came with it if it came with any. If you ARE using the software it came with, then try Windows 7’s. That’s all I can think of at the top of my head.

Read full topic

item.title: I need serious help! =(
item.dc:creator: @r0ckstar96 r0ckstar96
item.description:
@r0ckstar96 wrote:

So for Christmas I got a laptop with Windows 7 Home Premium. The wireless internet sometimes randomly dc’s and when I try and reconnect it says “Unable to connect to [network name]”. Half the programs on my laptop that I’ve downloaded don’t work because of my gay firewall. My firewall is screwed up big time! I’ve tried playing runescape and I get redirected to http://world17.runescape.com/error_game_js5connect.ws because my firewall or something is blocking off port 43594. I made an exception in my firewall (In the inbound connections section) for port 43594 but it still gets blocked. I’ve tried downloading Trend Micro and House Call to scan for viruses but they can’t be installed because “I’m not connected to the internet”. I’ve tried opening Firefox, Safari, Netscape, Google Chrome, and Flock, but all of those so that they can’t display the webpage and that I’m not connected to the internet. One program said I was having troubles with my proxy settings but I don’t have a proxy set up! So these are 2 things I’m having serious troubles with:
My firewall.
My internet connection.
Please help! I’m posting for help here because I know there are LOTS of 1337 computer wiz’s here that can help. How do you think I should fix my problems I’ve been having? Oh, by the way, I’ve tried shutting off my firewall but that did nothing.
